channel.title: Need help finding the person who made this sample [Found]
channel.description:
Hey guys n gals,
I sampled a sound from Auxy and can’t find where I got the sample from and I want to post the edit I did with his/her permission.
Please check out the track below. The sample is the main riff chord.
https://app.auxy.co/projects/fBk-dQ_VTbXvxYAHnrZ-wQ==
Thanks ever so much
Ant

item.title: Need help finding the person who made this sample [Found]
item.dc:creator: TribalSoul
item.description:
@Matik aaah legend thank you ever so much.

Appreciate it

Read full topic
item.source: Need help finding the person who made this sample [Found]

item.title: Need help finding the person who made this sample [Found]
item.dc:creator: Matik
item.description:
Oh yeah, that bass line on the top of the project is one that I made last year, I put it up on this thread:

Share your unused projects here! Work in Progress
Mod note: Any project link in this topic is freely available for your use. Any tracks produced from the provided project should be posted in the #tracks category once finished (not in this thread). And ideally give some credit to the person who provided the original project file. Hey guys! So I was going through some of my Auxy projects and figured that some of you may want some projects for your own personal use, so I’m gonna put all of my unused projects in this topic, and if I have more to…

I am indeed ‘Creepz’, it’s my repost account alias

But to conclude this thread, yes, you can use the bass riff I made

Read full topic

(I mean considering he runs this account: https://soundcloud.com/creepzrecords)

Read full topic

item.title: Need help finding the person who made this sample [Found]
item.dc:creator: TribalSoul
item.description:
@ezA Yeah I checked out the name and searched on Auxy’s forum and couldn’t find the post. I did find someone named creepz but it isn’t him/her as far as I can tell.

Perhaps they got the sample from someone else…either way I’d rather get permission to use it if I can.

Read full topic
